name: tamaas

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Tamaas is a C++ library with a Python interface that efficiently solves
contact mechanics problems with periodic rough surfaces, plasticity,
adhesion and friction.

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: fftw-api
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). We believe that FFTW, which
is free software, should become the FFT library of choice for most
applications.

dependencies.name: petsc
dependencies.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pybind11
dependencies.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependencies.name: scons
dependencies.description: SCons is a software construction tool

dependencies.name: thrust
dependencies.description:
Thrust is a parallel algorithms library which resembles the C++ Standard
Template Library (STL).
